result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Defendant Theodore Kern in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Theodore Kern.  Attorney John M Wagner in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
22CF358 deft. to plea to Cts. 1, 3, 6, 7, dri balance.
22CF663 deft. to plea to Cts. 1 & 5, dri balance.  DRI 22CM349 & 21CM1520.
State recommends prison sentence i/s 3 yrs. probation with conditions as stated on the record.  In 22CF358 Cts. 6 & 7 120 days RCJ with  time served sentence, defense fta.

22CF358
PLEA: Cts. 1, 3, 6, 7: G
BTC: Cts. 1, 3, 6, 7: GUILTY.  Cts. 2, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10: DRI.

22CF663
PLEA: Cts. 1 & 5: G
BTC: Cts. 1 & 5: GUILTY. Cts. 2, 3, 4, 6-18: DRI.  Cases 21CM1520 & 22CM349: DRI.
PSI ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 2:39 PM Defendant Theodore Kern in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Theodore Kern.  Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. Upon Plea to Cts. 1, 3, 6 and 7 in case 22CF358, plea to Cts. 1 and 5 in 22CF663, the State would recommend 3 yr. probation in 22CF358 and 120 days RCJ, CFTS applied and a term of probation.  The State would DRI the remaining charges and the 2 Misd. cases. The court is rejecting this plea agreement.  The court would recuse himself and send it to another Judge if the parties request it.  Parties communicate.  The defendant wishes for the Judge to recuse himself.  BTC: Judge Gasiorkiewicz recuses himself.
